page.title: 11HOUSING IN EAST HADDON
page.content:
The last 20 years has seen the building of a number of modern houses in the grounds of larger old houses. This has also led to the building of several small cul de sacs. Most of this housing has been of the executive type and has served to emphasize the differences between the true village folk and the commuters. As the sewers of the village are now at full capacity all future development has to be severely limited.
On numerous occasions recently plans have been put forward for secondary developments in back gardens etc.. To date these have all been turned down.
Of long term concern however must be the absence of large quantities of housing at the lower end of the market to attract young families to the village and maintain the school.
